data.text: I know I'm still running behind and haven't yet shared all the exciting experiences from my recent two months in the US, but here's something that sparked my curiosity just as much as I hope it does yours. üöÄ In February, during a weekend visit to Las Vegas, I had the chance to drive by the Sphere Entertainment Co.. Coincidentally, at the NVIDIA GTC shortly thereafter, there was an amazing panel that provided a fascinating look into the future of live entertainment and immersive experiences. Understanding the behind the scenes from the creators! üåê‚ú® üé§ Hearing from Alex Luthwaite, Joshua Grow, and Paul Breen of Sphere Entertainment, along with Andrew "AJ" Johnson from 7thSense , was a deep dive into the innovative technologies pushing the boundaries of audience engagement. They shared the complexities of integrating a 160,000 sq FT LED screen with compound curved panels, designed to enhance shared experiences without the isolation of VR. üìä The technical challenges discussed were as massive as the screen itself‚Äîmanaging 16K native content, processing data at 30 gigs a second, and handling an infrastructure that supports petabytes of data throughput with real-time, low-latency performance. This setup uses NVIDIA's ConnectX-6 network cards and a multi-petabyte NAS storage system to ensure that the massive data flows smoothly through the network. ü§Ø üëÄ Seeing the Sphere firsthand was nothing short of breathtaking. Then, hearing and learning from the creators was impressive to connect on what's possible when technological innovation meets creative vision. And I think the next step, one day, would be for me to get inside and experience a show. ü§∑‚ôÇÔ∏è üì±Check out my video below for a glimpse of the Sphere, capturing the essence of this architectural and technological marvel from just meters away, simply incredible. #gtc24 #realentertainment #techinnovation #spherelasvegas
